Fix FormattingInfoTest (https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=53548)
 - Updated test log files to include receivers package in class name
 - Updated RewriteAppender appender definitions to correct package (log4j.receivers.rewrite)
 - Updated test-compile target in extras build.xml to put companion.jar before log4j.jar (both contain FormattingInfo but they are different)

creator: sdeboy@iname.com
text:
Still failing...issue is two forms of FormattingInfo exist, one in log4j core and one in the extras companion, and the log4j core version is being picked up. 

I thought I had resolve this by updating the classpath in the ant script, but it didn't work when Gump ran.  The tests fail for me at the XSLT test.  I'm not sure why the log4j snapshot is being picked up first when the tests run..any ideas?

creator: grobmeier@gmail.com
text:
I think the easiest way is to rename that class (the companion one).

Not sure if it is an general agreement but I really try to avoid classes with same names/paths as it always leads to problems (at least in my projects).

As we have some non-bc changes we might easily rename this to for example CompanionFormattingInfo or move it to another package

wdyt?

creator: sdeboy@iname.com
text: Extras now passing in gump after a change to the gump config to put the extras classes ahead of log4j in the test classpath.
